Name: Marcs
AboutMe:
At 6 I got an Atari 2600, at 10 my first Amiga 500. Started programming and playing music on it. At 13 my first PC with an Intel 486DX 33Mhz, from then I started programming and reverse engineering on everything I got my hands on, for example during university I was cracking code on PSX ISO's using HEX editors.

I'm a Linux user from 2001, I loved and cursed most of the famous and infamous distributions, you name it: Red Hat, Debian, Gentoo, Ubutnu, Slackware, Crux and finally I fell in love with Arch Linux.

I developed on various languages PHP, Js, Java, Lua, Python, C, C++, C#; but now I'm mostly interested in functional languages like Scala and Haskell.

I worked as a freelancer for a 2 and half years, and on the last three years I'm working as consultant for developing and maintaining actuarial systems.

In the last year I'm also experimenting in VR on the Oculus Rift DK2, on Leap Motion, and on Android.
